thread.title: Beyoncé Begins the Matriarchy at the Grammys
thread.title_full: Beyoncé Begins the Matriarchy at the Grammys

title: Beyoncé Begins the Matriarchy at the Grammys
text: She had so much fun turning lemons into lemonade that she decided to try turning water into wine. And this performance! Like, how do we even continue to find words for Bey's live stunts? She spent the first two minutes doing power poses and soulfully gazing at the camera while a recording mused about the nature of motherhood and literally every Mother's Day card I ever gave burst into flames. And then when she started to sing, even gravity lost its damn mind. Getty "What are you doing tonight? "Just hanging out. LOL." Beyoncé to her set designer: The look I'm going for is Mother's Day brunch for 25 at the Cheesecake Factory meets The Last Supper. Can you do that? Getty The dancers bowing down around her isn't even in the choreography. They were just too shewk to keep standing. Getty Same. In the end, Beyoncé's perfect performance was a paean to the power of motherhood. "Your mother is a woman," she said. "And women like her cannot be contained." Everyone! It's happening. THE MATRIARCHY HAS BEGUN. Follow R. Eric Thomas on Twitter. More from ELLE:
